title: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome: Common and Misunderstood
author: Mike Mersol-Barg
description: Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) affects at least 1 in 6 women struggling with infertility. Learn about its effect on women's health throughout a lifetime.
cleaned_text: syndrome affects at least 1 in 6 women struggling with infertility. Its effects are felt beyond fertility from birth throughout a lifetime. Polycystic ovary syndrome is really a misnamed medical condition. Our patients often comment the name conjures ideas of large cysts on the ovaries causing concern for big tumors, possible cancer and need for surgery. Such a conclusion couldn't be further from reality. A better way to think of this condition is: a genetically based disorder of metabolism impairing the body's ability to manage sugars, cholesterols and other chemistry that may impair many organs in the body including a woman's reproductive balance, function of the ovary, eggs and fertility potential. There is a collective worldwide movement in the medical community to change the name of this condition in terms such as Metabolism and Ovary Dysfunction Syndrome Please go to our [PCOS page](https://www.mireproductivemedicine.com/who-we-help/polycystic-ovary-syndrome/) to learn more about: - The history of PCOS. - The most current consensus of criteria to confirm the diagnosis. - How to treat PCOS from childhood through menopause. There is good hope to live a full and fertile life with polycystic ovary syndrome. Understanding the cause and how it can affect one's health empowers us to enact a smart and successful treatment strategy.
